channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023080953
item.description:
Report X-2023080953

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Aug 4th, during the PM sort a shipment of drums were found that had no markings or indications that the drums contained any DG. After investigating the paperwork that was included an SDS was found that identified the inner contents as UN3077 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, solid, n.o.s.(diflubenzuron), 9, PGIII. There were no shippers declarations of dangerous goods with the shipment either. DG Admin advised for the station to hold the shipment until further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080604
item.description:
Report X-2023080604

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded from the trailer and was accidentlly dropped out of the unloaders hands. which in turn caused the damage and leaking to occur. pkg was cleaned up and drummed awaiting disposition. DescribePack: pkg seemed to be in fine condition and well packed inside with partitions and paper to compact it all. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pkg was quickly brought to qa attention and cleaned up and drummed. anything in the area was cleaned while others were told to stay away from the area. all materials are drummed up and waiting for dispostion.

item.title: Report E-2023070992
item.description:
Report E-2023070992

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/25/2023, personnel at the CSX Queensgate Yard in Cincinnati, OH, reported AXZZ 32036, a loaded tank car of Xylene Ethylbenzene (ALOX), was observed leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Kraton Chemicals, was notified via CHEMTREC (report #2023-07-25-00327). James Courtney, a CSXT hazardous materials manager, was dispatched to the scene and found (2) of (6) manway cover bolts less than tool tight. The manway bolts were tightened to secure the car for movement inside the yard. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to Kraton Chemicals representative: Gerri Sage (904-316-3655, Gerri.Sage@Kraton.com). Prior to releasing the car into transportation, HEPACO, a CSX response contractor, cleaned the impacted surfaces on the top and sides of the car, inspected the manway gasket, re-secured all manway cover bolts tool tight, and applied manway custody seal #000102. Delay in 5800.1 submission due to online portal not accepting submission.

item.title: Report E-2023070924
item.description:
Report E-2023070924

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/27/2023, at 1725 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge Yard discovered TILX307496, a residue tank car of Pentanes, leaking from the protective housing. The car was isolated and the shipper Marathon, was notified via CHEMTREC (report 2023-0727-00103). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line valve partially closed and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s emergency contact: Michael Murray (606-922-4079). Contractor personnel closed the angle valve and secured the secondary closure. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport.

item.title: Report X-2023080556
item.description:
Report X-2023080556

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Put Overpack box that contained 5 gallon drum into hazmat bag and into FedEx black storage bin. DescribePack: Bottom of drum is slowly leaking contents of methanol; bottom of drum is slightly dented. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Put box into hazmat bag and into FedEx black plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2023080509
item.description:
Report X-2023080509

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: MIAMISBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was brought to the QA area and it was leaking. There was a salty like texture to the the outside. When opened there was another box inside that had the hazmat label. No markings were found on the first box. The internal box was clearly labeled as corrosive with hazmat label. There was no paperwork as well. DescribePack: There were signs that the product seeped out the sides of the caps and down the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper removal and separation of product in the bin and put into the hazmat cage to wait for instructions.

The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080253
item.description:
Report E-2023080253

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023, ten (10) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the pallet on the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE personnel utilized absorbent pads and a degreasing solution to wipe down any impacted freight. Crews cut up the impacted pallet with hand tools and took it for waste. TLE personnel restacked and rewrapped the remediated freight for further shipment. All used absorbent pads, the cut-up pallet, the ten (10) damaged pails, and any miscellaneous waste were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums.

item.title: Report E-2023080201
item.description:
Report E-2023080201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 20, 2023, four (4) 50-pound bags of sodium nitrate were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE utilized hand tools and a hepa vac to the sodium nitrate-impacted trailer interior. Spent product and damaged bags were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums for terminal disposal. Impacted hepa vac liner, PPE and debris were contained in a separate drum liner.

  • City: Perrysburg

item.title: Report E-2023080134
item.description:
Report E-2023080134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: FAYETTE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During post trip inspection driver noticed material coming from drain tube from top of CT. Inspection revealed shipper personnel failed to properly close vent valve. Open valve allowed 3 cups of material to be released during transportation. Driver closed vent properly preventing material release. Load transported and delivered without additional incident.

item.title: Report E-2023080105
item.description:
Report E-2023080105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Trailer had been dropped in drop lot for delivery on Monday 7/31/23 when facility personnel went to retrieve trailer to be unloaded they noticed the spillage under trailer. Containment was set up and trailer was immediately unloaded to get to leaking container. The container was packed in a salvage drum and all contents were cleaned up using the proper PPE and absorbents then deposed of in the proper manner. The gravel under trailer was excavated and disposed of accordingly the new gravel was put back. The spill did not pose a threat to human life or waterways. The failure of the container was determined to be a crack in the bottom of the plastic drum.

  • Description: During offloading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5-gallon pails of coating (un1139) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report I-2023080021
item.description:
Report I-2023080021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: MIDDLEBURG HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/23/23 at 12:30 am, a ground package coming out of door 37 caught on fire while on the sort aisle conveyor belt. One of the aerosol cans in the package leaked and caught fire. The fire dept was called at 12:31 am and 225 employees were evacuated from the building. The fire was then extinguished by the Base mechanic and Sort Supervisor. At approximately 12:58 am the fire dept gave all clear to go back insidethe building and the sort operation started again after belt cleanup at 1:17 am.

  • Description: The liquid flange bolts were loose causing sloshing and release of product during normal car movement found during switching operations in Sharonville. The immediate area was isolated, contractor responded for securement and the shipper notified for C6 repairs and leak test.
